Package ohos.aafwk.abilityjet.activedata

Class ActiveData<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.aafwk.abilityjet.activedata.ActiveData<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Indicates the type of data to observe.

    public class ActiveData<T>
extends Object
    Saves data and observes data changes.

    ActiveData can be used to save Component data in the Model or record database data in the Model. ActiveData is essentially a data class, and observers are added to observe its data changes. When a data change occurs, the ActiveData object can notify its observers of the change.

    While the ActiveData is being observed, it also observes lifecycle changes of the DataObserver. Generally, a DataObserver can be notified of data changes only when the AbilitySlice hosting the observer is in the foreground (ACTIVE state) since it does not need to know real-time data changes in other states. After it returns to the foreground, the DataObserver will be notified the most recent data changes.

    ActiveData can also notify an observer of data changes even when the AbilitySlice is in the background state. To enable this function, set the always parameter in the addObserver(ohos.aafwk.abilityjet.activedata.DataObserver,boolean) method to true when you add the observer.

    You do not need to maintain the observers. When the lifecycle of an AbilitySlice is destroyed, the related observer is automatically removed. Therefore, ActiveData can be seen as an observable data type that can observe lifecycle states. The biggest advantage of ActiveData is that it serves as a lifecycle observer and notifies other observers of data changes based on the lifecycle of an object.

    Example code of using ActiveData:

     public class MainAbility extends Ability {
        private ActiveData fruitPrice;

        @Override
        protected void onStart() {
            super.onStart();
            subscribe();
        }

        @Override
        protected void onActive() {
            if(fruitPrice.getData().empty()) {
                // setData will notify Observer in subscribe.
                fruitPrice.setData(String("10"));
            }

            private void subscribe() {
                final DataObserver priceObserver = new DataObserver() {
                    @Override
                    public void onChanged(@Nullable final String s) {
                        String price = "Fruit price is " + s;
                        Text.setText(price);
                    }
                };
                fruitPrice.addObserver(priceObserver);
            }
        }
 }

    1

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActiveData

        public ActiveData​()

    • Method Detail

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver​(DataObserver<T> observer,
                        boolean always)
        Adds a data observer.

        After a data observer is added, it will be notified when data is changed.

        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the data observer to add for receiving data change notifications. The value cannot be null.
        always - Specifies whether to send data change notifications in any lifecycle state. The value true indicates that notifications are sent in any lifecycle state. The value false indicates that notifications are sent only when the object is in the foreground (ACTIVE state).

      • removeObserver

        public void removeObserver​(DataObserver<T> observer)
        Removes a data observer.

        After a data observer is removed, it will no longer be notified of data changes.

        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the data observer to remove.

      • setData

        public void setData​(T value)
        Sets the data to observe.
        Parameters:
        value - Indicates the data to observe.

      • getData

        public T getData​()
        Obtains the active data.
        Returns:
        Returns the active data.
